result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon Edward Oaks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Serve 90 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon Edward Oaks

defendant.name: Oaks, Jonathon Edward
defendant.address: Pierce County Jail 432 W. Main Street, Ellsworth, WI 54011

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jonathon Edward Oaks in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant Jonathon Edward Oaks in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court of agreement, defendant will plead to single count in Information, amend to eliminate repeater allegation, parties agree 90 days jail concurrent to jail on any other sentence and credit for 126 days served.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Def. pleads guilty to amended information.  Counsel stipulates to facts.  Court accepts plea, finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, & understandingly waives his constitutional rights.  The court finds the defendant guilty.  Proposal appropriate & adopted, sentenced to 90 days in the PCJ with credit for time served.  Court waives costs given situation.

Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by phone means for Defendant Jonathon Edward Oaks. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means.  Defendant currently in custody in Pepin County.  Mr. Oaks set for SEHR on Pierce Co. case on 8/31, counsel have an agreement on this case.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared in Pierce County for Defendant Jonathon Edward Oaks. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Response to Demand for Discovery
Letter from Pierce County to counsel re: scheduling

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Court advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Counsel to send written request for substitution request.

Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. on record.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  Defendant wishes to proceed with Arraignment based upon charges in complaint.

Defendant Jonathon Edward Oaks appeared by phone means with attorney Melissa Peterson from Pierce County Jail. Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including right to prelim. hrg.  State requests cash bond.  Court sets $1000 cash bond.  Defendant waives right to P.H., requests substitution of Judge.
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge.
